女性職員「特急との差額ほしい」、普通定期に払い戻し…変造も

02 Nov 2019, 20:00

　通勤に使うＪＲ九州の特急定期券を普通定期券に払い戻して差額を不正に受け取ったとして、大分県は１日、商工観光労働部の出先機関所属の女性職員（５１）（係長級）を同日付で停職４か月の懲戒処分にしたと発表した。区間は小倉駅―中津駅で、県は職員の不正が約４年間に及んだとみなして、差額の約１１０万円を返納させた。
　発表によると、職員は北九州市在住で、２０１４年２月から計４回、半年間分の特急定期を購入。通勤手当を受けるために職場にコピーを提出した後、ＪＲの窓口で普通定期にして差額の払い戻しを受けた。
　県によると、職員は「職場で実物を確認された時のため」として、普通定期を特急定期に似せて変造。昨年２月、変造した２枚の定期券が拾得物としてＪＲ九州に届けられて発覚した。
　同社は同年１０月に福岡県警小倉北署に有価証券変造容疑で告訴した。その後、女性と同社との間で和解が成立。福岡地検小倉支部は今年８月に不起訴とした。
　職員は「差額が欲しかった。特急に乗って通勤した際、車掌から定期券の確認をされなければ、不正乗車をしたこともある」と話しているという。記者会見した和田雅晴・県総務部長は「県職員の信頼を著しく失墜させる行為で大変申し訳ない」と謝罪した。

Female staff "I want the difference from the limited express", refund on a regular basis ...

02 Nov 2019, 20:00

Assuming that the JR Kyushu express commuter pass used for commuting is refunded to a regular commuter pass and the difference is received illegally, Oita Prefecture will be accompanied by a female employee (51) (person in charge) who belongs to the branch office of the Ministry of Commerce and Tourism. Announced that it was disciplinary for 4 months of suspension. The section was from Kokura Station to Nakatsu Station, and the prefecture assumed that the staff had been cheated for about four years and returned the difference of about 1.1 million yen.
According to the announcement, the staff is living in Kitakyushu City and purchased a limited number of limited express trains for half a year from February 2014. After submitting a copy to the workplace to receive a commuting allowance, the difference was refunded at regular intervals at the JR counter.
According to the prefecture, the staff changed the regular period to resemble an express period, as “when the actual thing is confirmed at the workplace”. In February of last year, two commuter passes that had been altered were delivered to JR Kyushu as discovery and discovered.
In October of the same year, the company filed a complaint with the Fukuoka Prefectural Police Ogura Kita Station on charges of alteration of securities. Later, a settlement was established between the woman and the company. The Fukuoka District Prosecutor Kokura Branch was not charged in August this year.
Employees said, “I wanted a difference. When I got on a limited express and commute, I could have boarded an illegal ride without confirming the commuter pass from the conductor.” Masaharu Wada, General Manager of the Prefectural General Affairs Department at the press conference, apologized, "I am very sorry for the act of significantly losing the trust of the prefectural staff."
